page_content:
Hierarchy

Version:MissionOS_2.0

Once you set up a project using the Project configuration interface, the next step is to configure the hierarchy of the project. The MissionOS contains a powerful system for setting a hierarchy of information visibility and responsibility. Within this hierarchy Projects can be divided into a variety of levels including Contracts, Sites, Zones and Sections.

In addition to Geographic hierarchy – hierarchies based on data type can also be implemented. By assigning each Job and Sub Job to a hierarchy, the access for instrumentation data can be controlled and restricted to specific user groups.

You can perform the following steps to access this page:

  1. Log into the MissionOS portal.
  2. Click open the Data Manager.

 

 

 

In Data Manager, navigate to Admin > Setup > Hierarchy


The Project tab is open by default.

  1. Click Add New.
  2. Enter the Project Name. For example, QAProject.
  3. Enter the Description.
  4. Click Save Project.
    The project gets saved and is listed in the table.
    You can edit and delete project details, if required.

 

 

 

Each Project will be linked hierarchically to a Contract, Site, and Zone respectively. Go through the following instructions to see how QAProject can be hierarchically linked with newly created contract, site and zone.

 

Note:

These settings are mandatory for all projects. For smaller projects they can be filled as “default”.

 

Note:

  • A single Project can be linked to multiple contracts.
  • A single Contract can be linked to multiple sites.
  • A single Site can be linked to multiple zones.

 

 

 

To add Contract, navigate to Contract tab.

  1. Select the specific Project as QAProject (example) from the dropdown, for which contracts is to be added.
  2. Click Add New.
    The Contract entry fields populate.
  3. Enter the Contract Name. For example, Contract 1.
  4. Enter the Description.
  5. Click Save Contract.
    The contract details get saved in the table.

In the same way you can add multiple contracts to the Project such as Contracts 1, Contract 2, and Contract 3.

 

 

 

To add a Site to QAProject > Contract 1, click open the Site tab.

  1. Select the Project and Contract from the respective dropdowns.
  2. Click Add New.
    The Site entry fields populate.
  3. Enter the Site Name. For example, Site 1.
  4. Enter the Description.
  5. Click Add Site.
    The site details get saved in the table.

 

 

 

To add a Zone to QAProject > Contract 1 > Site 1, click open the Zone tab.

  1. Select the above Project, Contract and Site from the respective dropdowns.
  2. Click Add New.
    The Zone entry fields populate.
  3. Enter the Zone Name. For example, Zone 1.
  4. Enter the Description.
  5. Click Add Zone.
    The zone details get saved in the table.

 

 

 

 

To view hierarchy of project, contract, site and zone,

  1. Open Hierarchy
  2. Select a specific Project from the list of projects.
  3. Next, select Contract, then Site and Zone to view a hierarchy.

 

 

 

If there is large volumes of data, you can upload the project details with hierarchy of project, contract, site and zone through file process. For this, follow the instructions below:

  1. Click open Upload
  2. Click Download Sample File.
  3. Enter the hierarchical details.
  4. Click Add File (select hierarchy mapping file from your computer to create hierarchy).
    The hierarchy mapping file gets added to the application.
